div.l: At whiche gate / is he gan / he gan to crye
The wyf cam lepyng / Inward at a renne
She seyde Allas / your hors goth to the fen
With wilde maris / as fast as he may goo
Vnthank com̄ on his hondis / that boond hym soo
And he that bettir / sholde haue knytt the reyne
Alas qduod Iohn / Alayn for goddis peyne
Ley doıı̄un thi swerd / and I wol myn alswa
I is as swyft god wot / as is a ra
Bi cokkis herte / he shal nat skape / vs bathe
Whi ne hadde thou put / the capil in the lathe
Ill hayl Aleyn / bi god / thou is a fonne
This sely clerkes / han faste I ronne
Toward the fenne / bothe Alayn and eek Iohn
And whan the miller / sawh that they were gon
He half a bushel of here flour / hath take
And bad his wyf / go knede it in a kake
And seide I trowe / this clerkis were a ferd
Yit kan a millere / make a clerkis berde
For Alle hir art / yit lat hem gon her way
Lo wher they gon / ye lete the childre play
They gete hym nouht / so lyghtly bi my crowne
This sely clerkis / rennen vp and doıı̄un
With keepe keep / stand stand / Io sa and warderere
Ga whistil thou / and I shall kepe hem heere
But shortly / til it was verray nyht
They cowde nat / thouh they dedyn al ther myht
Her capil cache / he ran alway so faste
Til in a dich / they cauht hym at the laste
Wery and weet / as beste is in the reyne
Comyth seely Iohn / and with hym comyth Aleyn
Allas qduod Iohn / the day that I was born
Now ar we dryven to ethen ⁊and to scorn
Our corn is stole / men wol vs fooles calle
Bothe the wardeyn / and our felawes Alle
And namely the millere / weleaway
Thus pleyneth Iohn / as he goth bi the way
